repnme.cdata!: Cote d'Ivoire - Health and Demographic Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Health and
            Demographic Project for Cote d'Ivoire was satisfactory.
            The project achieved most of its objectives, institutional
            development was partially achieved, sustainability is
            likely, and the performance of the Bank was satisfactory
            while the Borrower's was marginally satisfactory.
            Several lessons can be learned from this project. First,
            project scope and content should be coherent and support an
            agreed sector strategy and program that is based on a
            consensus and agreed upon by the different Government
            departments. Second, at the project's start, agreement
            should be reached on performance indicators. They should be
            reviewed through project launch workshops, annual
            programming exercises, and a mid-term assessment. Third,
            project management arrangements should be agreed upon,
            including staffing commitments and the roles of key
            technical units. Fourth, Bank missions should be more
            frequent, with a skill mix tailored to the technical and
            management requirements of the project. Finally, the Bank
            may want to consider a shorter timeframe for future
            projects, with phased implementation based on an agreed work
            program with the Government.

docna.cdata!: Cote d'Ivoire - Health and Demographic Project

repnme.cdata!: Ivory Coast - Health and Demographic Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Health and Demographic Project, the
            Bank's first in the health sector, will assist the
            Ministry of Public Health & Population (MOPHP) to
            strengthen health manpower development through expansion of
            nurse training capacity to address current shortages,
            through implementation of a revised curriculum, including
            family planning & field training, that is more
            responsive to the health needs of the country, & through
            development of health manpower planning capacity; (b)
            improve MOPHP management capability & efficiency of
            health service delivery by strengthening: (i) the Central
            Directorates through development of a management information
            system & improvement in planning & operations; (ii)
            major hospitals through management training, development of
            cost containment programs & strengthening of key
            services; (iii) basic health services through training
            programs for all staff including auxiliaries & programs
            in management, supervision & evaluation. The project
            will also assist the Ministry of Economy & Finance (MEF)
            to improve the availability of demographic information
            through strengthening of the Directorate of Statistics to
            carry out a program of demographic data collection &
            analysis, including a national population census & a
            subsequent migration survey.

docna.cdata!: Ivory Coast - Health and Demographic Project

Ivory Coast - Health and
